A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: 3.5/5. Tone issues and pacing issues for sure\, forced love interests and a little too much slapstick but a solid\, dramatic and action packed plot that kept me on my seat and asking more questions\, making me excited and intrigued for the next installment. (SPOILER TALK) The side plot with Finn was a little unnecessary. In the end\, what they did didn't really matter\, the rebels were retreating anyway. I felt it was all just so they could force a connection between that one girl and him. Poor forced love interests make me sad. What's with all the slapstick? I mean it was humorous at times (although very scarce) but I feel like it couldn't decide between being more dramatic or comedic. I also felt the use of Luke was good. He had some really good arcs.
